gurmukhi: kyqkin BRm ju`D mcwvq ]Awhv sIJ idvwlX pwvq ]402]
transliteration: Ketkan(i) Bhram Juddh Machaavat|| Aahav Seejh Divaalaya Paavat||402||
translation: Many are roaming and fighting and embracing martyrdom are leaving for heaven.402.

gurmukhi: kyqk jUJ mrq rx mMfl ]kyeIk Byd cly bHmMfl ]
transliteration: Ketak Joojh Marat Ran Mandal|| Keeek Bhed Chale Brahmandal||
translation: Many are dying while fighting in the battlefield and many after going through the universe are getting separated from it;

gurmukhi: kyeIk Awn pHwrq swNgY ]kyqk BMg igrq huie AwNgY ]403]
transliteration: Keeek Aan Prahaarat Saanad|| Ketak Bhan Girat Hue Aanad||403||
translation: Many are striking blows with their lances and the limbs of many, being chopped, are falling down.403.

gurmukhi: Bwj ibnw Bt lwj sBY qj swj jhwN ]nwcq BUq ipswcin swcr rwj qhwN ]
transliteration: Bhaaj Binaa Bhat Laaj Sabhai Taj Saaj Jahaan|| Naachat Bhoot Pisaachanndi) Saachar Raaj Tahaan||
translation: Many warriors abandoning their shame, and leaving behind everything, are running away; and the ghosts, fiends and imps dancing in the battlefield, are ruling over it;

gurmukhi: dyKq dyv Adyv mhwN rx ko brnY ]jUJ BXo ijh Bwq su pwrQ sO krnY ]404]
transliteration: Dekhat Dev Adev Mahaan Ran Ko Barnai|| Joojh Bhayo Jih Bhaat Su Paarath Sau Karnai||404||
translation: The gods and demons all are saying this that this war is dreadful like the war of Arjuna and Karan.404.

gurmukhi: dwv krY irs Kwie mhwN hT Twn hTI ]kop Bry ieh BwNq su pwvk jwn BTI ]
transliteration: Daav Darai Ris Khaae Mahaan Hath Hathee|| Kop Bhare Eh Bhaant Sr Paavak Jaan Bhathee||
translation: The persistent warriors, in their fury, are striking blows and they appear like the furnaces of fire;

gurmukhi: kRu`D Bry rx CqRj AqRx Jwrq hY ]Bwj clY nhI pwvs mwr pukwrq hY ]405]
transliteration: Kruddh Bhare Ran Chhatraj Atran Jhaarat Jai|| Bhaaj Chalai Nahipaavas Maar Poukaarat Hai||405||
translation: The kings in their ire are striking their weapons and arms; and instead of running away, they are shouting “Kill, Kill”.405.

gurmukhi: dyKq hY idv dyv DnY Dn jMpq hYN ]BUm AkwS pqwl cvo ck kMpq hY ]
transliteration: Dekhat Hai Div Dev Dhanai Dhan Janpat Hain|| Bhoom Akaadh Pataal Chavo Chak Kanpat Hain||
translation: The gods and demons both are saying, Bravo!" Looking at the fighting; the earth, sky, neither-world and all the four direcitions trembling;

gurmukhi: Bwjq nwhn bIr mhwN rx gwjq hYN ]j`C BujMgn nwr lKy Cb lwjq hYN ]406]
transliteration: Bhaajat Naahan Beer Mahaan Ran Gadjat Hain|| Jachchh Bhujanad Naar Lakhe Kanpat Chhah Laajat Hain||406||
translation: The warriors are not running away, but are thundering in the war-arena; seeing the glory of those warriors the women of Yakshas and Nagas are getting shy.406.

gurmukhi: Dwvq hYN kr kop mhwN sur sUr qhwN ]mwNfq hYN ibkrwr BXMkr ju`D jhwN ]
transliteration: Dhaavat Hain Kar Kop Mahaan Sur Soor Tahaan|| Maandat Hain Bikraar Bhayankar Juddh Jahaan||
translation: The great warriors, getting enraged, have attacked and are waging a dreadful and frightening war;

gurmukhi: pwvq hYN sur nwr su swmuih ju`Jq hYN ]dyv Adyv gMDRb sBY kiRq su`Jq hYN 407 ]
transliteration: Paavat Haiaa Sur Naar Su Saamuh(i) Jujjhat Hain|| Dev Adev Gaddhrab Sabhai Krit Sujjhat Hain||407||
translation: Embracing martyrdom in the ear, they are meeting the heavenly damsels and this war appears as a great war to all the gods, demons and Yakshas.407.

gurmukhi: mwrby ko qwih qwik Dwey bIr swvDwn ]hon lwgy ju`D ky jhwN qhwN sBY ibDwn ]
transliteration: Maarhe Ko Taah(i) Taak(i) Dhaae Beer Saavdhaan|| Hon Laage Juddh Ke Jahaan Tahaan Sabhai Bidhaan||
translation: In order to kill Kalki, the warriors cautiously marched forward and began to wage war here, there and everywhere;
